Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Lateral Lymph Node Involvement in Rectal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: A post hoc analysis of the OPRA trial, a multicenter randomised controlled trial, was conducted.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included rectal cancer with LLN involvement.

Intervention.evidence: Patients with locally advanced rectal cancer were treated with total neoadjuvant therapy (TNT) followed by total mesorectal excision or watch-and-wait management.

Objective.evidence: This study assesses LLN involvement in rectal adenocarcinoma patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was disease recurrence, assessed over a follow-up period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was centralised, with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 324 patients, 57 (18%) had visible LLN (LLN+) on baseline MRI.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Post-TNT, LLN disappeared in 30 (53%) of these patients.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Disease recurrence in LLN was rare, occurring in 3.5% of LLN+ and 0.4% of LLN− patients.
